Description: A quality control tool for high throughput raw sequence data.
Features: It generates quality reports for NGS data and gives pass/fail results for the following checks: Per base sequence quality, Per sequence quality scores, Per base sequence content, Per base GC content, Per sequence GC content, Per base N content, Sequence Length Distribution, Sequence Duplication Levels, Overrepresented sequences, Kmer Content. It also has a Graphic User Interface.
Strength: It is easy to use; provides visualization in HTML reports; can be used on Illumina, PacBio, 454 reads.

Description: The FASTX-Toolkit is a collection of command line tools for short-reads FASTA/FASTQ files preprocessing.
Features: The sub-command "fastx_trimmer" can be used to shorten reads (removing barcodes or noise) in FASTQ files . The sub-command "fastqx_clipper" can remove sequencing adapters or linkers.
Strength: Besides "fastx_trimmer" and "fastx_clipper" in this toolkit, there are multiple tools and commands for processing FASTA/FASTQ files. It can also be integrated and used on the web-based bioinformatics platform Galaxy.
Limitation: Last updated in 2010. {"value": "Be ware of the older base quality encoding. ", "link" : "https://wikis.utexas.edu/display/bioiteam/FASTQ+Manipulation+Tools" }

Description: A flexible read trimming tool for Illumina NGS data
Features: It can trim adapter sequences, remove low-quality reads and bases.
Strength: It is designed as more pair-aware for paired-end data. The authors found trimmomatic to run faster than cutadapt and FASTX-Toolkit.  ({"value":"see Trimmomatic paper","link":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4103590/"})

Description: Cutadapt finds and removes adapter sequences, primers, poly-A tails and other types of unwanted sequences from high-throughput sequencing reads.
Features: Cutadapt helps with various trimming tasks by finding the adapter or primer sequences in an error-tolerant way. It can also modify and filter reads in various ways. Adapter sequences can contain IUPAC wildcard characters. Also, paired-end reads and even colorspace data are supported. If you want, you can also just demultiplex your input data, without removing adapter sequences at all ({"value":"see manual","link":"https://media.readthedocs.org/pdf/cutadapt/stable/cutadapt.pdf"}).
Strength: It supports 454, Illumina and SOLiD (colour space) data. It is used inside another tool called {"value":"Trim Galore","text":"https://www.bioinformatics.babraham.ac.uk/projects/trim_galore/"}, also a quality control tool by the FastQC team.

Description: A tool for mapping short reads using the idea of layered seed structures similar to multiple filtration.
Features: It uses quality scores in mapping; performs paired-end reads mapping; maps bisulfite sequencing reads to ordinary reference genome.
Strength: It maps reads using quality scores in a refined way; monitors ambiguous mapping locations.

Description: BS Seeker transforms the genome into a three-letter alphabet and then uses Bowtie for alignment.
Features: It works with bisulfite reads generated from the two different existing experimental protocols; uses sequence tags to reduce mapping ambiguity; performs post-processing of alignments.
Strength: It runs considerably faster than RMAP and BSMAP.

Description: Bismark performs mapping and methylation calling in a single step.
Features: It performs bisulfite mapping and methylation calling in one single step.; supports single-end and paired-end read alignments; supports ungapped and gapped alignments. Alignment seed length, number of mismatches etc. are adjustable. Output discriminates between cytosine methylation in CpG, CHG and CHH context.
Strength: It supports paired-end reads and variable read length.
Limitation: Increased runtime compared to other tools due to lower probability of reporting non-unique alignments.
Platform requirement: Perl, Bowtie or Bowtie 2, recommended machine: at least 5 cores + >16GB RAM

Description: Alignment tool tailored for Reduced representation bisulfite sequencing (RRBS) data.
Features: The read length can be up to 144 nt, allowing up to 15 mismatches, gap size up to 3 bp. It supports single-end and paired-end mapping; supports multi-thread mapping; supports both "Lister protocol" (sequence 2 forward strands only) and "Cokus protocol" (sequence all 4 bisulfite converted strands).
Strength: It offers better runtime performance compared to other tools, maintaining comparable mapping accuracy.

Description: General purpose bisulfite sequencing alignment tool.
Features: It integrates novel mismatch counting, list filtering, mismatch stage filtering and fast mapping onto two indexes components to improve unique mapping rate, speed and precision.
Strength: It runs faster and more accurate than BSMAP, BS-Seeker, and Bismark ({"value":"BatMeth paper","link":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3491410/"}).

Description: Map short reads from ILLUMINA, SOLiD and Roche-454 technology.
Features: It performs fast gapped and ungapped alignment onto a reference sequence; uses a filter based on precomputed short-word alignments; does final alignment by dynamic programming.
Strength: It uses a pre-computed score table for faster mapping.

Description: Alignment, quality control and analysis pipeline for whole-genome bisulfite sequencing data.
Features: It performs unbiased read alignment step; computes quality assessment metrics; does local averaging to improve precision; detects DMRs considering biological variability.
Strength: Shown to work well for even low coverage data and also handles biological replicates in the analysis.
Limitation: Assumes that the true methylation profile is smooth, therefore the tool might not be suitable to detect single CpGs.

Description: Alignment, quality control and analysis pipeline for whole-genome bisulfite sequencing data.
Features: It compiles quality assessment measures based on stratifying methylation estimates by read position.
Strength: Quality assessment plot for each uniquely aligned read.

Description: Performs simple quality control before differential methylation analysis
Features: It considers sample-wise coverage distributions.
Strength: It has convenient R functions for statistics and plots.
Limitation: Only few options available for quality control.

Description: A Streamlined Analysis and Annotation Pipeline for RRBS data.
Features: It performs read quality check, adapter trimming, alignment, methylation data extraction, annotation, reporting, and visualization; handles both single-end and paired-end reads.
Strength: Integrated all steps for CpG methylation analysis into one pipeline, where the user starts with sequenced reads and finally gets a CpG methylation report.

Description: Bismark performs mapping of bisulfite treated sequencing reads and methylation calling in a single step.
Features: It performs bisulfite mapping and methylation calling in one single step; supports single-end and paired-end read alignments; supports ungapped and gapped alignments. Alignment seed length, number of mismatches etc. are adjustable. Output discriminates between cytosine methylation in CpG, CHG and CHH context.
Strength: Supports paired-end reads and variable read length.
Limitation: Increased runtime compared to other tools due to lower probability of reporting non-unique alignments.
Platform requirement: Perl, Bowtie or Bowtie 2, recommended machine: at least 5 cores + >16GB RAM

Description: Integrative Genomics Viewer is a popular visualization tool for viewing large heterogeneous genomics datasets.
Features: Display of sample attributes such as clinical and phenotypic data, interactive exploration of data using click and drag to pan the view and double-click to zoom into a region, real-time interaction at all scales of genome resolution.
Strength: It can integrate multiple types of datasets, including methylation data; offers smooth loading at different resolutions.

Description: Exploratory analysis and visualization of bisulfite sequencing data.
Features: It imports DNA methylation sequences, aligns and performs quality control comparison. Features include: lollipop visualization, co-occurrence display of methylation of neighbouring and distant CpG sites, summary statistics on methylation status, clustering and correspondence analysis.
Strength: The authors provide a convenient R package for analysis and visualization. It performs quality control as well in one of the steps.

Description: The tool mainly performs differential methylation analysis, aids in sample clustering, annotation and visualization.
Features:
Features include: coverage statistics,
methylation statistics,
sample correlation and clustering,
differential methylation analysis,
feature annotation and accessor/coercion functions, 
multiple visualization options,
regional and tiling windows analysis,
reading methylation calls directly from [Bismark(Bowtie/Bowtie2)],
batch effect control,
multithreading support, 
coercion to objects from Bioconductor package GenomicRanges,
reading methylation percentage data from generic text files.
Strength: It provides a comprehensive and flexible R package for differential methylation analysis.

Description: Alignment, quality control and analysis pipeline for whole-genome bisulfite sequencing data.
Features: It finds regions that show consistent differences even when considering biological variation.
Strength: Shown to work well for even low coverage data and also handles biological replicates in the analysis.
Limitation: Assumes that the true methylation profile is smooth, therefore the tool might not be suitable to detect single CpGs.

Description: An approach to detect significantly differentially methylated regions (DMR) accounting for spatial dependence.
Features: It detects CpG clusters; smoothes methylation data within CpG clusters; model and test group effect for each CpG site within CpG clusters; apply hierarchical testing procedure to get DMR boundaries.
Strength: It uses a hierarchical procedure for testing target regions, leading to a more powerful approach than BSmooth and methylKit.
Limitation: The method is particularly suited for targeted sequencing approaches such as RRBS. Analysis is limited for whole-genome sequencing data.

Description: Differential methylation analysis
Features: The tool produces statistically significant DMRs and connects to nearest genes and CpGs.
Strength: The method also describes differentially methylated fragments (DMF) based on MspI fragments.

Description: The tool mainly performs differential methylation analysis, aids in sample clustering, annotation and visualization.
Features:
Features include: coverage statistics,
methylation statistics,
sample correlation and clustering,
differential methylation analysis,
feature annotation and accessor/coercion functions, 
multiple visualization options,
regional and tiling windows analysis,
reading methylation calls directly from [Bismark(Bowtie/Bowtie2)],
batch effect control,
multithreading support, 
coercion to objects from Bioconductor package GenomicRanges,
reading methylation percentage data from generic text files.
Strength: It provides a comprehensive and flexible R package for differential methylation analysis; Calls differential CpGs.
